title: Ticket #3128: Remove ClassAd instance from FileTransfer object?
description:
When discussing shadow memory usage, Dan cleverly pointed out that FileTransfer object keeps a copy of the job's ClassAd.

It's not readily obvious how this will interact with the ClassAd caching, but it is pretty easy to remove this. I did some investigation and found the ClassAd was really only used for:

  • Owner
  • NT domain
  • Cluster
  • Proc
  • Universe

It's pretty easy to store these separately. Tim - thoughts?

If we think ClassAd caching applies here, maybe we want to go the opposite direction - remove things from the object instance which may also be in the classad?
